FuncDef: The display ntp-service statistics packet command displays statistics about global NTP packets.
CLIs: display ntp-service statistics packet [ ipv6 ] interface { <interface-name> | <interface_type> <interface_num> | all }
display ntp-service statistics packet peer [ [ <ipv4Addr> [ vpn-instance <vpnName> ] ] | ipv6 [ <ipv6-address> [ vpn-instance <vpnName> ] ] ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays NTP packet statistics on a specified IPv6 peer.
-

Displays the packet statistics on all interfaces.
-

Displays packet statistics on IPv4 peers.
-

Displays NTP packet statistics on a specified IPv4 peer.
The value is an IPv4 address in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the name of a VPN instance associated with the NTP peer.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
This command provides the following information, which can be used for debugging NTP:
Number of NTP packets sent by the peerNumber of NTP packets sent to the peerNumber of NTP packets processedNumber of NTP packets dropped
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
